items.title: What the official scikit-learn certification looks like
items.author: probabl
items.content:
We got a lot of questions about our certification program. Some of these questions weren't so much on the material, but more on the medium and interface of the actual exam. 

That why we made this small recording. It shows what you can expect as we go through a few questions in a mock exam.

00:00 Intro and setup
01:56 Starting the exam
03:19 First questions
05:41 Programming exercise
09:47 Final review at the end

To learn more about the official scikit-learn certification program go here: 
https://certification.probabl.ai/

items.title: When precision equals recall
items.author: probabl
items.content:
Precision can actually be equal to recall. For balanced datasets it can even be pretty common! But understanding when this happens may also help you understand both metrics a bit more. 

00:00 Introduction 
00:32 Experiment setup 
03:45 Code
06:45 Why? 
09:30 Math proof via sympy

Appendix with notebooks:
https://github.com/probabl-ai/youtube-appendix/tree/main/16-metrics

items.title: Making a recommender by just using Polars!
items.author: probabl
items.content:
Can we make a movie recommender by just leveraging a DataFrame library? We like to think so, which is also a great excuse for us to dive deeper into Polars. It is a bit unconventional, but that might just be a reason to explore it!

The Marimo notebook for this livestream can be found over here:
https://github.com/probabl-ai/youtube-appendix/blob/main/00-livestream/bayes-recommender.py

The dataset for this livestream can be found here:
https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/rounakbanik/the-movies-dataset

Website: https://probabl.ai/

items.title: Precision, recall and F1-score
items.author: probabl
items.content:
Metrics are important. If you are careless with them you will have a bad time comparing algorithms. That's why we will dive deeper into metrics in the next few videos. To get things started, let's dive into precision, recall and the F1 score. These metrics are common, but they are also intimately related.

00:00 Introduction
00:30 Example
04:46 Shape of F1 score
06:37 Code

Appendix with notebooks:
https://github.com/probabl-ai/youtube-appendix/tree/main/16-metrics
